kubejs.ponder.tag.corrupted_pixie.descri: A stepping stone for making Aureal Essence
kubejs.ponder.tag.arcane_obelisk.descrip: Youre gate to infinite Arcane Dust
kubejs.ponder.ars_recipe.text_1: Ars Nouveau offers magical recipes using magic catalysts
kubejs.ponder.ars_recipe.text_2: The enchanting apparatus requires a core underneathe it, while an imbuement chamber does not
kubejs.ponder.ars_recipe.text_3: Place recipe ingredients in pedestals one block from the catalyst (enchanting apparatus in this case)
kubejs.ponder.ars_recipe.text_4: Place middle ingredient in the catalyst
kubejs.ponder.ars_recipe.text_5: The recipe will begin, but may require source nearby
kubejs.ponder.ars_recipe.text_6: The enchanting apparatus consumes materials in pedestals while the imbuement chamber does not
kubejs.ponder.assembly_line.text_1: This is an assembly line. It allows for specific recipes
kubejs.ponder.assembly_line.text_2: For the assembly to successfully work, each component must be in contact
kubejs.ponder.assembly_line.text_3: Place required program for a recipe in the controller
kubejs.ponder.assembly_line.text_4: The drill will work with programs that require the drill
kubejs.ponder.assembly_line.text_5: The laser works in the same way
kubejs.ponder.assembly_line.text_6: The importer and exporter are required to input/output items and will take from nearby inventories
kubejs.ponder.assembly_line.text_7: The platform is the station where programs will be completed
kubejs.ponder.basin_table.text_1: Tables and basins are used for casting fluids
kubejs.ponder.basin_table.text_2: Use a faucet or channel to cast fluids
kubejs.ponder.basin_table.text_3: Placing items inside a basin or table can result in different recipes when casting
kubejs.ponder.basin_table.text_4: This is an ingot cast. It will mold certain fluids into an ingot
kubejs.ponder.basin_table.text_5: Hoppers can be used to automatically input items...
kubejs.ponder.basin_table.text_7: Create funnels and other methods of transportation are also compatible
kubejs.ponder.chamber_size.text_1: Pressure chambers can be three different sizes
kubejs.ponder.chamber_size.text_10: Different chambers sizes also differ in max pressure
kubejs.ponder.chamber_size.text_11: Exceeding max pressure will explode the chamber
kubejs.ponder.chamber_size.text_15: A security upgrade will release air when nearing the danger zone
kubejs.ponder.chamber_size.text_5: Because each pressure chamber recipe uses 1000 mL of air, it may be convenient to have a larger chamber
kubejs.ponder.chamber_size.text_6: Larger pressure chambers can hold a larger volume of air
kubejs.ponder.chute_duct.text_1: A hopper can directly input items into a controller
kubejs.ponder.chute_duct.text_2: However, a chute can be used to input items as well
kubejs.ponder.chute_duct.text_3: A duct can filter fluid input/output
kubejs.ponder.chute_duct.text_4: Place a bucket or can filled with fluid inside the duct to filter that fluid
kubejs.ponder.corrupted_pixie.header: Converting Corrupted Pixies into Corrupted Pixie Jars...!
kubejs.ponder.corrupted_pixie.text_2: Rightclick it with a Corrupted Pixie, and Boom. You got yourself a Corrupted Pixie Jar
kubejs.ponder.corrupted_pixie.text_3: You can now mine it for the Corrupted Pixie Jar Item!
kubejs.ponder.faucet_channel.text_1: Faucets can pour fluids from various containers
kubejs.ponder.faucet_channel.text_2: Power faucets with redstone to keep it constantly pouring
kubejs.ponder.foundry.text_1: The foundry is made out of scorched materials
kubejs.ponder.foundry.text_2: Unlike the smeltery, it requires scorched blocks in its corners
kubejs.ponder.foundry.text_3: Like the smeltery, the foundry smelts items and can pour fluids
kubejs.ponder.foundry.text_4: However, the foundry has a few differences
kubejs.ponder.foundry.text_5: 1. It can hold a larger amount of fluid than a smeltery
kubejs.ponder.foundry.text_7: 3. Smelting materials such as ore will result in byproduct such as extra ore
kubejs.ponder.foundry.text_8: 4. Smelting items can give multiple products such as netherite tools giving diamonds and netherite back
kubejs.ponder.foundry.text_9: Scorched and seared basins/tables/faucets/channels are compatible with both the foundry and the smeltery
kubejs.ponder.hephaestus.text_2: This is a tutorial on how you can build it.
kubejs.ponder.hephaestus.text_3: Start by placing blocks of §9Arcane §9Chiseled Polished Darkstone §ron the highlighted spots
kubejs.ponder.hephaestus.text_4: Then, surround the center block with §9Chiseled Arcane Polished §9Darkstone
kubejs.ponder.hephaestus.text_5: To finish the first layer, surround all blocks with §9Polished Darkstone
kubejs.ponder.hephaestus.text_6: Finally, place a §9Smithing Table §rin the middle...
kubejs.ponder.menril.text_1: Replace all Enriched Menril Logs with normal Menril Logs
kubejs.ponder.menril.text_2: Finally place a Arboreal Extractor directly on the center trunk
kubejs.ponder.obelisk.header: Farming Arcane Crystals from Arcane Crystal Obilisks
kubejs.ponder.obelisk.text_1: First, place an Arcane Polished Darkstone Block.
kubejs.ponder.obelisk.text_2: Then, place two Arcane Crystal Blocks above it.
kubejs.ponder.obelisk.text_3: This is the Arcane Crystal Obelisk Multiblock
kubejs.ponder.obelisk.text_4: Rightclick it with a Mundabitur Dust to assemble it (This can also be done with deployers)
kubejs.ponder.obelisk.text_5: You can now mine it for the obelisk item!
kubejs.ponder.our_amogus_scene.text_1: This is the Arcane Space Time Construct (ASTC)
kubejs.ponder.our_amogus_scene.text_10: To finish, you need to throw 6 Singularities from AE2 onto it. And if that is met, it will transform into a Orb of flight
kubejs.ponder.our_amogus_scene.text_2: It needs a bunch of inworld processes to get converted to a Flying Orb!
kubejs.ponder.our_amogus_scene.text_3: Firstly, lets Strike it by lightning!
kubejs.ponder.our_amogus_scene.text_4: Lightning will set the ASTC 1 Phase ahead. Keep in mind, does the clock on the ASTC run out it will destroy itself.
kubejs.ponder.our_amogus_scene.text_5: Next we shall Light a Disruptive TNT next to it.
kubejs.ponder.our_amogus_scene.text_7: Now you need to place the ASTC on a Black Hole made by throwing Dark Matter and Corrupti Dust together on the ground.
kubejs.ponder.our_amogus_scene.text_8: Now Immerse the ASTC with Liquid Space Time!
kubejs.ponder.our_amogus_scene.text_9: Now were at stage 4! It's Cashout time!
kubejs.ponder.our_third_scene.text_1: This is the Source Time Crystal!
kubejs.ponder.our_third_scene.text_10: You can actually figure out the exact spells the Source Crystal wants, by using NBT Reading from Integrated Dynamics"
kubejs.ponder.our_third_scene.text_11: Now,before you start firing spells like a madman. Let me tell you. Theres rules to the game.
kubejs.ponder.our_third_scene.text_12: Everytime You Shoot a Spell the Time Crystal, it checks if The Spell Contains one of the Desired Spells, and then Ticks that off its internal list. Are all spells completed, it will convert to ancient debris!
kubejs.ponder.our_third_scene.text_13: If the Fired Spell contains more than 1 effect, it wont consider the Spell and Increase its internal Cooldown. If the Fired Spell doesnt contain a Spell of Interest to the Block, then the countdown shall also be increased
kubejs.ponder.our_third_scene.text_14: Realistically, you need 10 Spell Turrets with all of the different Possible Spells. If you dont want to bother with NBT reading, you can just fire the 10 Turrets in 8ish second intervals
kubejs.ponder.our_third_scene.text_15: Now for the Nerdier Explanation: The Time Crystal takes 5 random entries out of this array: "hex","light","gravity","ignite","cold_snap", "intangible","freeze","crush","grow","firework". The 5 Spells are Defined by the following. It oversimplified does a 50/50 Split on the Possible Spell array, and then makes that its internal Spell Goal array. Each spell, no matter the correct matching internal spells will only increment the Time Crystals Stage by 1. Thats basically it. Dont overstress it, just fire spells at it :)
kubejs.ponder.our_third_scene.text_2: Now ensues a Text Driven Explanation on how to do it (cause animating it is seriously too hard)!
kubejs.ponder.our_third_scene.text_3: What does the Source Time Crystal automate? Well, im glad you asked! Depending on Dimension it produces different items. Diamonds in the Overworld, Ancient Debris in the Nether, and Fireworks in the End.
kubejs.ponder.our_third_scene.text_4: But before that. These are Spell Turrets, they will be used to automate the Time Crystal.
kubejs.ponder.our_third_scene.text_5: Rightclicking with a spell scroll inscribed at a Scribe's table will set the Spell for the turret.
kubejs.ponder.our_third_scene.text_6: A redstone pulse will activate the turret, and fire the specified Spell. I'm too lazy to animate it
kubejs.ponder.our_third_scene.text_7: To get back to the original Point though, heres how the Time Crystal works. First Ill explain it simply, and then afterwards with Code for the nerds.
kubejs.ponder.our_third_scene.text_8: The Time Crystal Spawns with a set of Spells it Desires
kubejs.ponder.our_third_scene.text_9: These Spells can only be in the range of these spells: "hex","light","gravity","ignite","cold_snap", "intangible","freeze","crush","grow","firework"
kubejs.ponder.pressure_chamber.text_1: A pressure chamber is created with pressure chamber blocks
kubejs.ponder.pressure_chamber.text_10: Connect pressure tubes to the valve to connect to various pressure machines
kubejs.ponder.pressure_chamber.text_11: Machines such as compressors can supply/take air from the chamber
kubejs.ponder.pressure_chamber.text_12: Right click the pressure chamber to see its interface
kubejs.ponder.pressure_chamber.text_13: The chamber will diagnose problems as well as provide statistics
kubejs.ponder.pressure_chamber.text_14: Upgrades such as the volume upgrade can be added inside the interface
kubejs.ponder.pressure_chamber.text_2: A pressure chamber is used to compress items for various recipes
kubejs.ponder.pressure_chamber.text_3: The chamber requires a valve that allows air to enter/leave the pressure chamber
kubejs.ponder.pressure_chamber.text_4: Two pressure chamber interfaces are required. One facing inside the chamber as the input...
kubejs.ponder.pressure_chamber.text_5: And one facing outside the chamber as the output
kubejs.ponder.pressure_chamber.text_6: Pressure chamber glass is used for decoration
kubejs.ponder.pressure_chamber.text_7: Interfaces/valves cannot be placed in corners of the chamber
kubejs.ponder.pressure_chamber.text_8: Input items into the interface through a hopper or modded transportation
kubejs.ponder.pressure_chamber.text_9: Compressed items will automatically output into an inventory
kubejs.ponder.pressure_tubes.text_1: Pressure tubes move air between compressors and machines
kubejs.ponder.pressure_tubes.text_13: Example: A compressor that provides 20 bar pressure...
kubejs.ponder.pressure_tubes.text_14: ...will cause this tube to explode first
kubejs.ponder.pressure_tubes.text_15: ...and will cause this tube to explode next as pressure builds up further
kubejs.ponder.pressure_tubes.text_2: Air moves in the direction where pressure is lower
kubejs.ponder.pressure_tubes.text_3: Example: An air compressor supplies air here
kubejs.ponder.pressure_tubes.text_4: ...and the air will distribute through the tube
kubejs.ponder.pressure_tubes.text_5: Open tubes will leak air, but can be closed by using a wrench
kubejs.ponder.pressure_tubes.text_7: Pressure tubes have a maximum pressure
kubejs.ponder.pressure_tubes.text_8: Exceeding this pressure will explode the tube
kubejs.ponder.pressure_tubes.text_9: Reinforced and advanced tubes have a higher pressure threshold
kubejs.ponder.scorched_table_basin.text_: Seared tables and basins can not accept fluid without a cast
A gold platform in a basin acts as an empty cast
Gold bars on a table acts as an empty cast
Scorched and seared basins/tables are compatible with both the foundry and the smeltery
kubejs.ponder.seared_channel.text_1: Channels can distribute fluid in multiple directions. Use a faucets to pour onto channels
kubejs.ponder.seared_channel.text_2: Right click channels to change flow of direction.
kubejs.ponder.seared_channel.text_3: Example: Right clicking in the middle of the channel will allow flow downward
kubejs.ponder.seared_channel.text_4: Channels can distribute fluid into other channels
kubejs.ponder.smeltery_intro.text_1: The smeltery is made out of seared materials
kubejs.ponder.smeltery_intro.text_10: Faucets will pour automatically if powered with redstone
kubejs.ponder.smeltery_intro.text_11: Faucets will pour the fluid at the bottom of the smeltery. Right click on fluids inside the smeltery controller interface to change a fluid to the bottom.
kubejs.ponder.smeltery_intro.text_12: A create mechanical pump can input/output fluids from a drain
kubejs.ponder.smeltery_intro.text_2: Only breaking the smeltery controller loses materials inside the smeltery
kubejs.ponder.smeltery_intro.text_3: These seared glass blocks are purely cosmetic
kubejs.ponder.smeltery_intro.text_4: Every smeltery requires a smeltery controller to function
kubejs.ponder.smeltery_intro.text_5: Placing certain items inside such as ore will smelt them into fluid
kubejs.ponder.smeltery_intro.text_6: A seared fuel gauge is used to supply the smeltery with fuel
kubejs.ponder.smeltery_intro.text_7: Fuel the smeltery with energy fluids such as lava
kubejs.ponder.smeltery_intro.text_8: Seared drains allow fluids to be transferred from/to the smeltery
kubejs.ponder.smeltery_intro.text_9: Use seared faucets to pour fluid onto a table/basin/spout and other fluid containers
kubejs.ponder.smeltery_sizing.text_5: The max smeltery size is 14x14 and height of 64
kubejs.ponder.smeltery_sizing.text_6: Larger smelteries have less fuel efficiency
kubejs.ponder.tube_modules.text_1: Modules can be added to tubes to change their behaviour
kubejs.ponder.tube_modules.text_10: A module expansion card can be applied to modules to allow advanced settings
kubejs.ponder.tube_modules.text_11: Example: A regulator is capped at 4.9 bar but can be customized with an expansion card
kubejs.ponder.tube_modules.text_2: Right click with desired module on a tube to apply it
kubejs.ponder.tube_modules.text_3: The air grate is very effective at cooling down heat sinks
kubejs.ponder.tube_modules.text_4: And it can repel/attract entities depending on positive/negative pressure
kubejs.ponder.tube_modules.text_5: The safety tube module releases air when nearing maximum pressure
kubejs.ponder.tube_modules.text_6: The vacuum tube module takes pressure at the wide green end and moves it to the narrow red end
kubejs.ponder.tube_modules.text_7: You can achieve 'negative' pressure using the vacuum
kubejs.ponder.tube_modules.text_8: The regulator caps the amount of pressure allowed through
kubejs.ponder.tube_modules.text_9: The charging module charges items in the inventory its pointing at
